EntityTemplateUserControl Class

Definition

Defines the base class for entity templates.

In this Article

public class EntityTemplateUserControl : System.Web.UI.UserControl

Remarks

Entity templates are user controls that apply to an entity (a table) instead of to a single data field, as with field templates. An entity template typically contains several DynamicControl controls for rendering data fields.

Constructors

EntityTemplateUserControl()

Initializes a new instance of the EntityTemplateUserControl class.

public EntityTemplateUserControl ();

Properties

ContainerType

Gets the type of the data-bound control that contains this entity template.

public virtual System.Web.DynamicData.ContainerType ContainerType { get; }
Value
ContainerType

The type that contains the template.

Remarks

The ContainerType class provides information about the context (the control type) in which the EntityTemplateUserControl class is contained. This type can be a list control, such as a GridView or ListView control. It can also be a single-item control, such as a DetailsView or FormView control.

You can customize the behavior of an application depending on the ContainerType value, such as conditionally displaying or hiding specific UI elements.

Mode

Gets the data-rendering mode for the entity.

public System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControlMode Mode { get; }
Value
DataBoundControlMode

The data-rendering mode for the entity.

Table

Gets the table that the entity template applies to.

public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable Table { get; }
Value
MetaTable

The table that the entity template applies to.

ValidationGroup

Gets the validation to apply to the entity control group.

public string ValidationGroup { get; }
Value
String

The validation to apply to the entity control group.
